open_spaces_details.description: The application is develop the grass area between the existing tennis courts into two new padel courts for public use.
open_spaces_details.open_space_type: Outdoor sports facilities incl. school playing fields

description: Alterations including erection of 2x floodlit padel courts between the existing tennis courts and installation of tweener lighting to the existing tennis courts 5 and 10.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [1311-1130, 1311-1300, 1311-1301, 1311-1302, 1311-1000 REV: A, 1311-1200, email from bm-architects dated: 12/10/2023, 001 dated:17 NOV 2023, PRELIMINARY ECOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT ref: ASW/AST/092/25/2021, Flood Risk Assessment - P1 2230174, BAT ASSESSMENT NO. ASW/AST/091/25/2021, Acoustic Assessment Report No. 22-0029-0 R01a, Padel Strategy dated: February 2023]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - Prior to commencement of the above groundworks, details of landscaping and treatment of parts of the site not covered by buildings, to include the hard landscaping materials, species of new tree and shrub planting, and any existing plants/trees to be retained, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. All planting, seeding, and turfing included in the approved details shall be carried out prior to first use of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and biodiversity value in the development, in accordance with Council policies LP1, LP2 and LP56 of the Local Plan. The details are required prior to the commencement of works to ensure the landscaping measures are incorporated in the layout and construction of the development.
Condition : 4 - Prior to commencement of any preparatory works, submit for approval a Construction Environment Management Plan (CEMP) including: 
a)	whilst works should take place outside of the nesting season (February - September), if works are unavoidable during this period, then a site walk over at least 48 hours prior to works commencing is required by a named CIEEM accredited ecologist with experience of working in London to check for any nesting birds.
b)	details of measures to minimise detrimental environmental impacts (e.g. dust, noise etc) on the surrounding King George's Park;   
c)	methods to prevent the entrapment of mammals during construction; 
d)	details of any construction lighting if necessary and how negative impacts on bats and other species will be avoided;
e)	details of how materials will be stored onsite;
f)	details of the routing of construction vehicles, time of arrival and departure, measures to be implemented to ensure the safety of the public when using the footpath immediately to the east of the construction site, and in any other areas within the park adjacent to the works; 
g)	any proposed temporary traffic and pedestrian management measures during the course of construction.

No development shall commence until such time as the Construction Environment Management Plan (CEMP) has been approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Environment Management Plan (CEMP). 

Reason: To retain accessible use of Metropolitan Open Land throughout construction and in the interests of traffic, general amenity of the area; to prevent harm to protected and priority species and retain the ecological interest of the site. The details are required prior to the commencement of works to ensure existing biodiversity is protected and the landscaping measures are incorporated in the layout and construction of the development. 
Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of above ground works, final details of the lighting to be installed including features such as baffles and net shielding to reduce the impacts of the proposed lighting on sensitive species. The specifications should align with the recommendations of the bat survey report and the Bat Conservation Trust and ILP artificial lighting guidance.
Reason: In the interests of preotecting protected species and neighbour amenity, in accordance with Local Plan Policies LP2 and LP55.
Condition : 6 - Post construction completion, but prior to operation, a Post Completion Light Spillage Report demonstrating that the "as built" lighting is in accordance with the lighting specifications outlined in condition 5 of this decision notice, shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved floodlighting shall only be used/operated between hours of 15.30 and 21.00.

Reason: to prevent harm to protected and priority species in accordance with Policy LP55 of the Local plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023

Condition : 7 - The padel tennis courts hereby approved shall only be operational between the hours of:

[09:00 - 20:00] Mondays - Sundays 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan  coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 8 - Prior to first operation of the padel courts hereby approved, a management plan shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The submitted plan shall include details of how the padel tennis courts would be managed and operated to minimise noise disturbance to local residents. The Courts should be managed and operated in accordance with the approved plan unless otherwise agreed in perpetuity unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  

REASON: In the interests of preventing undue noise disturbance to preserve neighbour amenity in accordance with Local Plan Policy LP2 and preventing.

Condition : 9 - The development permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved Flood Risk Assessment [by *** dated *****].
The mitigation measures shall be retained as such.
Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and future occupants, and third parties in accordance with policy LP12 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
site_name: The Tennis Hut King Georges Park
